thread.title: Hawkins 911 supervisor Brianna Hill awarded Excellence in Dispatching Certificate
thread.title_full: Hawkins 911 supervisor Brianna Hill awarded Excellence in Dispatching Certificate

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Hawkins 911 supervisor Brianna Hill awarded Excellence in Dispatching Certificate
text: Hawkins County 911 announced Wednesday that Emergency Communications Supervisor Brianna Hill has earned the Excellence in Dispatching Certificate from the National Emergency Number Association (NENA). This prestigious certificate is awarded to individuals who have successfully completed a minimum of three advanced courses within two years from NENA. “The Excellence in Dispatching Certificate is a testament to Brianna Hill’s commitment to her profession and her dedication to providing exceptional emergency communication services,” said 911 director Lynn Campbell. “By earning the certificate, Brianna has not only demonstrated her expertise in dispatching but has also gained the skills to be an effective team leader. This achievement will undoubtedly open doors for long-term success in the field of emergency communication.” Campbell said Hawkins County Emergency Communications District takes great pride in the accomplishments of its staff members and recognizes their continuous efforts to enhance their skills and knowledge. Brianna Hill’s achievement reflects the high standards and professionalism that Hawkins County ECD strives to uphold. “We are extremely proud of Brianna Hill for earning the Excellence in Dispatching Certificate,” Campbell said. “Her dedication and commitment to her role as an Emergency Communications Supervisor is commendable. This achievement not only reflects her personal growth but also enhances the overall quality of service we provide to our community.” Hawkins County 911 remains committed to ensuring the safety and well-being of its residents, Cambell said. The continuous professional development of its staff members, such as Brianna Hill, plays a crucial role in achieving this goal. Subscribe to The Rogersville Review
